title: Senior Supporter Engagement Officer Interview
Interview Descriptions: The candidate is given a presentation topic before the interview, of which we have to prepare in advance. Typical Face to face discussion to start with, discuss the role and candidate's CV. Then it comes the presentation with followup questions.
Interview Questions: What fundraising product would you create to attract Donner's?

title: Community Outreach and Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Interview Descriptions: all day assessment pre Covid in office and it took part in London. came for the delay and it was several group and individual interviews. I then had a medical assessment to check.
Interview Questions: they asked what I could bring to the trip abroad

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at VSO in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Online application, written test, panel interview and lastly written test.  After that they called me and gave me the offer. It was a smooth process from applying to getting the final offer.
Interview Questions: How do you develop a communications strategy for a project?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at VSO (London, England) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Apply online and you'll then be contacted via email and over the phone. You'll then be asked to an assessment day where you'll interact with other people, ask to participate in group exercises and interviewed individually.
Interview Questions:
When was a time you showed adaptability? 
What drives you? 
What is VSO's mission?

title: Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at VSO (London, England) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The first activity at the assessment centre was to work in teams and build giraffes using newspaper, tape, scissors and a stapler. At certain points teams had to swap and continue working on the giraffe of another team. Afterwards, there were lots of activities e.g. discussing how we would react to situations that could potentially come up on placement. There were a couple of facilitators and lots of staff just sitting around taking notes. Then there was an individual interview part with the usual questions, in a chilled and friendly mood. At the end we had to come up with a presentation of what we learned during the day.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you managed to teach something to someone

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at VSO (London, England) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: it was a long process from original application, after online situational judgement questions and then an assessment day where we were assessed on different situations and interviewed extensively on our opinions, what we wanted to do for the company etc. they gave us different tasks to look at and had to decide on the best strategy to approach the situation.
Interview Questions: Why did you want to join VSO

title: Overseas Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at VSO (London, England) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: group assessment day, it was just dull... activities did not encourage creativity and openness. Candidates were left alone for large parts of the day - of course we all interacted with each other but the whole thing just felt a bit poorly planned.
Interview Questions: how would you cope being away from home for extended periods of time?

title: Prospect Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at VSO (London, England) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very organised and detailed, it was a face to face interview with 2 friendly ladies, very positive experience
Interview Questions: Since it was a part time position I was asked if I would be happy and if I had plans how to afford to live

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at VSO (London, England) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview followed by two face-to-face interviews. The first interview was with a junior HR member and the second was with two senior directors.
Interview Questions: Asked lots of questions on the paper submitted in response to the task I was sent in advance of the first interview.
